notesStmt.note: Most of leaves partly damaged (lower margin). Stained.

Se῾adyah ben Yehudah Al-Ladani: inscribed in the colophon, folio 248r.Two records of birth, dated 1828 (1517) and 1833 (1522) respectively, in the main scribe's handwriting, folio 248r (below the colophon).A record of transfer of the manuscript between the owners, Se῾adyah ben Yehudah Al-Ladani and Se῾adyah ben Mantsur Al-Ḥawidi, dated 1544, folio 248r.Folio 1 and 249 contain portions of Leviticus XIV and XV, Hebrew text with Targum to each verse, both leaves are mutilated.Folio 2 (vellum) contain Genesis 29:27-30:10, Hebrew text with Targum to each verse, both provided with the superlinear punctuation.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A service book according to the Yemenite rite.

msItem.title: Services for Sabbath and other festivals
A series of ḳinot for Tish῾ah be-Av

collation.p: Quires of originally 10 leaves each, signed with Hebrew letters at the head of each quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square and semi-cursive script, partly punctuated, of the 16th century. Avigad ben Daṿid Al-Nisakh: inscribed, folio 248r.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Prayer Book. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2227.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 10 April 1880: inscribed, folio [250v] (fse001v).
